ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:1.2_0: the nuns asked questions of a monk who had not given permission.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:1.3_0: The monks complained and criticized them,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:1.4_0: “How can nuns ask questions of a monk who hasn’t given permission?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:1.5_0: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:1.9_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:1.10_0: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:1.11.1_0: ‘If a nun asks a question of a monk who has not given permission, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:2.1.4_0: ...The nun who has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:2.1.10_0: if she gets permission to ask about the discourses, but she asks about the Monastic Law or philosophy, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:2.1.11_0: If she gets permission to ask about the Monastic Law or philosophy, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:2.1.12_0: If she gets permission to ask about philosophy, but she asks about the discourses or the Monastic Law, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:2.2.1_0: If she has not asked permission, and she does not perceive that she has, and she asks a question, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:2.2.2_0: If she has not asked permission, but she is unsure of it, and she asks a question, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:2.2.3_0: If she has not asked permission, but she perceives that she has, and she asks a question, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:2.2.4_0: If she has asked permission, but she does not perceive that she has, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:2.2.5_0: If she has asked permission, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:2.2.6_0: If she has asked permission, and she perceives that she has, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:2.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:2.3.2_0: if she asks after getting permission;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:2.3.3_0: if she gets permission, but not in regard to a specific subject, and she then asks about any subject;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:2.3.5_0: if she is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:2.3.6_0: The twelfth training rule is finished.
